Line 2: Starting at (0.5578, 0.0) and ending at (0.5578, 0.75). 3. Line 3: Starting at (0.5578, 0.75) and ending at (0.0, 0.75). 4. Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.75) and ending at the origin (0.0, 0.0). Each line has two points, a start point and an end point. Close the loop by connecting the last point to the first point. Scale the 2D sketch horizontally and vertically by the factor of 0.75 as defined in the "extrusion" object of the JSON. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the part's "coordinate\\_system". Extrude the sketch along the positive Z-axis by the amount 0.0112, creating the final prism. Use the "extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal" value in the "extrusion" object of the JSON as the depth. This corresponds to the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" or creating a new solid body. The dimensions of the part are: - Length: 0.75 (0.5578 rounded to nearest 0.01) - Width: 0.0112 - Height: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism The object to be constructed is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face. The front face is the only one that is not parallel to the top or bottom faces. The dimensions of the front face are approximately 2:3 in height to width ratio. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other and are the same size. The sides of the prism are straight and perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The object is centered in the coordinate system. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.45, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. Draw the following lines to define the shape of the front face: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1125, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.1125, 0.0], End Point [0.1125, 0.75] * Line 3: Start Point [0.1125, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.6] * Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.6], End Point [0.0562, 0.6] * Line 6: Start Point [0.0562, 0.6], End Point [0.0562, 0.4875] * Line 7: Start Point [0.0562, 0.4875], End Point [0.0, 0.4875] * Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.4875], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The shape of the front face is a slightly angled rectangle, with the height being approximately twice the width. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction to a depth of 0.45 units, creating the 3D model of the rectangular prism.</description>
